ParentCompanyName: Air Liquide Large Industries U.S. LP

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Program (RMP)
The Hydrogen Purification process is closely monitored and controlled to prevent accidental releases to the environment.  Our commitment to Safety and Environmental Protection in the Air Liquide Large Industries U.S. LP (ALLIUS), Rodeo Hydrogen Plant must extend beyond the gates. As part of the community, we have a responsibility to our customers and to those who live in the surrounding area. Through safety, concern for the environment, and community involvement, we can develop a true partnership with our customers and neighbors.

Regulated Chemical
The design basis is to provide an efficient plant of high purity hydrogen product using Natural Gas, Refinery Fuel Gas A (RFGA), and Butane as feed stock.  Purified Hydrogen is sold to Industrial customer(s). 
The plant also produces steam and electricity, sold directly to Conoco PhillipsA? San Francisco Refinery.  The plant is designed for continuous operation and is designed for inherently safe operation.  

Accidental Release Prevention 
The flammability of this process makes it necessary for the Rodeo Hydrogen Plant to observe certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary exposure, and reduce the threat to personnel and nearby members of the community.  It is ALLIUSA? policy to adhere to all applicable federal and state rules and regulations.  Safety depends upon the manner in which we handle the material including equipment design and safe handling procedures used to operate the equipment.  ALLIUSA? release prevention program is based on inherently safe design, effective written procedures, training, and an overall commitment to safe work practices.  The Hydrogen equipment meets or exceeds design codes and standards.  Operations and maintenance personnel are thoroughly trained on proper procedures and safety hazards.

Emergency Response
ALLIUSA? Rodeo Plant has developed a comprehensive Emergency Response Program.  In the event of an accidental release, the emergency response plan i

ncludes notifying the San Francisco Conoco Phillips Refinery and the Rodeo Hercules Fire Department.  Annual drills will be conducted with plant personnel and these organizations to review response actions in the event of an accidental release.  Plant personnel receive regular training on implementation of the response plan in addition to participating in the drills.

Five Year Accident History
This is a first time submission.  As such, no accidents have occurred at this site.
